Name: Painted cartonnage panel from a mummy
Description: Painted cartonnage panel from a set of mummy-casings, with a green-blue border encasing a white-background field, in which a ram-headed god to the right faces two columns of hieroglyphic text identifying him as 'Khnum-Re lord of the Cataract'. In Egyptian belief Khnum created the physical forms desired for creation by the sun-god Re. Here Khnum is fused with Re to form the composite god, as at his principal cult-centres such as Elephantine in the First Cataract region, and Esna closer to Thebes. Possibly this panel, though acquired at Thebes, was found at a site where Khnum was worshipped; it is also possible that he was included on this panel as the god of the Cataract region, housing the revivifying sources of the Nile .
